data.title: Georgia football: How to watch UGA vs Ball State, streaming, radio info
data.meta_description: Everything you need to watch Georgia's Week 2 matchup.
data.text:
VIDEO: What we want to see from Georgia in Week 2 | Junkyard Dawgcast

ATHENS, Ga. — The No. 1 ranked Georgia Bulldogs are set to take the field on Saturday to face Ball State in Athens in the second game of the 2023 season. Here's the rundown on what to expect in the non-conference matchup.

TV, Streaming Info

Kickoff: NoonET, Saturday, Sept. 9

TV: SEC Network

Streaming:fuboTV

Gameday Schedule

8 a.m. ET - Pregame Broadcast Begins

9:45 a.m. ET - Dawg Walk

10 a.m. ET - Gates Open

Location: Dooley Field at Sanford Stadium

Weather: Mostly Cloudy, 80°, feels like 83°

Announcing Crew: Taylor Zarzour (play-by-play); Matt Stinchcomb (color analyst); Alyssa Lang (sideline reporter)

Atlanta -- 750 AM/95.5 FM - Scott Howard (play-by-play), Eric Zeier (color analyst), DJ Shockley (sideline reporter)

Albany -- WJAD FM 103.5

Americus -- WISK FM 98.7

2016 Record:

Georgia went 8-4, with a 4-4 Southeastern Conference record and a 31-23 win over TCU in the Liberty Bowl.

Ball State went 4-8, with a 1-7 Mid-American Conference record.

2017 Record:

Georgia went 13-2, with a 7-1 Southeastern Conference record, a 28-7 win over Auburn in the SEC Championship, a 54-48 win over Oklahoma in the Rose Bowl College Football Playoff Semifinal, and a 26-23 loss to Alabama in the College Football Playoff National Championship.

Ball State went 2-8, with a 0-8 Mid-American Conference record.

2018 Record:

Georgia went 11-3 with a 7-1 Southeastern Conference record, a 35-28 loss to Alabama in the conference championship, and a 28-21 loss to Texas in the Sugar Bowl.

Ball State went 4-8, with a 3-5 Mid-American Conference record.

2019 Record:

Georgia went 12-2 with a 7-2 Southeastern Conference record, a 37-10 loss to LSU in the conference championship, and a 26-14 win over Baylor in the Sugar Bowl.

Ball State went 5-7, with a 4-4 Mid-American Conference record.

2020 record:

Georgia went 8-2, with a 24-21 win over Cincinnati in the Chick-Fil-A Peach Bowl.

Ball State went 7-1, with a 5-1 Mid-American Conference record, a 38-28 win over Buffalo in the MAC Championship, and a 34-13 win over San Jose State in the Arizona Bowl.

2021 record:

Georgia went 14-1, with an 8-0 Southeastern Conference record, a 41-24 loss to Alabama in the SEC Championship, a 34-11 win over Michigan in the Orange Bowl CFP semifinal, and a 33-18 win over Alabama in the College Football Playoff National Championship

Ball State went 6-7, with a 4-4 Mid-American Conference record and a 51-20 loss to Georgia State in the Camellia Bowl.

2022 record:

Georgia went 15-0, with an 8-0 Southeastern Conference record, a 50-30 win over LSU in the SEC Championship, a 42-41 win over Ohio State in the CFP Semifinal, and a 65-7 win over TCU in the CFP National Championship.

Ball State went 5-7, with a 3-5 Mid-American Conference record.

2023 record:

Georgia is 1-0.

Ball State is 0-1.

Coaching staff:

Georgia: Head coachKirby Smart(eighth season), offensive coordinatorMike Bobo(fifteenth season, eighth as offensive coordinator, first season under Smart),co-defensive coordinator Glenn Schumann (eighth season, fourth as co-defensive coordinator), co-defensive coordinator Will Muschamp (third season, second as co-defensive coordinator)

Ball State: Head coach Mike Neu (eighth season), offensive coordinator Kevin Lynch (fourth season), defensive coordinator Tyler Stockton (fifth season)

Series History: This is the first game between the two programs.

The Bulldogs are now 82-15 under eighth-year head coach Kirby Smart, with a 48-9 record in conference play.

"On to Ball State for us," Kirby Smart said on Monday. "They've got a really good football team. I don't know their coach, Mike Neu, well but I get to meet him obviously. Got a lot of respect for their conference. We played Kent State out of their conference last year and the MAC has done an incredible job of creating a good football environment and some really good football teams. We got to put last game to bed this morning, which we don't usually get to do on Monday. But with no school, we're able to jump ahead. So this afternoon we'll jump into Ball State and get prepared for them."
